title: All In The Family spin-off Maude star Bill Macy has died age 97 leaving behind his wife
text:

Maude actor Bill Macy has died aged 97 on Thursday.

The American star was most recognised for his role in 1970s sitcom Maude alongside his co-star Bea Arthur. It was a spin-off of All In The Family.

Bill passed away at 7.13pm on Thursday evening.

The sad news was made public by his manager Matt Beckoff who paid tribute to the star on his Facebook account.

He wrote: "My buddy Bill Macy passed away at 7:13pm tonight.

"He was a spitfire right up to the end. My condolences to his beautiful wife Samantha Harper Macy."

Bill leaves behind his wife Samantha Harper Macy.

The couple were happily married ever since they tied the knot in 1975.

They first crossed paths on the off-Broadway play Oh! Calcutta! in 1969, six years before they were married.

He made his name in the spotlight on TV shows including Seinfeld, My Name Is Earl and Chicago Hope.

But his most recognisable role was on Maude as the patient husband Findlay.

The actor played his part in the show for six seasons from 1972 until 1978.

Another notable acting achievement included his starring role in the 1999 film Analyze This alongside Robert De Niro.
